text: was an old province in Japan in the area of Niigata Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Echigo" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 165. The province had borders with Uzen, Iwashiro, Kōzuke, Shinano, and Etchū Provinces. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. The maps of Japan and Echigo Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Geography== Echigo faced the Sea of Japan. ==Shrines and Temples== Iyahiko jinju and Koko jinja were the chief Shinto shrines (ichinomiya) of Echigo."Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 2 .
